last_episode_to_air.name: Rockets or Romance
last_episode_to_air.overview: Hogan and a beautiful underground agent team up to immobilize three mobile rocket launchers.

name: Hogan's Heroes
overview:
Hogan's Heroes is an American television sitcom that ran for 168 episodes from September 17, 1965, to July 4, 1971, on the CBS network. The show was set in a German prisoner of war camp during World War II. Bob Crane starred as Colonel Robert E. Hogan, coordinating an international crew of Allied prisoners running a Special Operations group from the camp. Werner Klemperer played Colonel Wilhelm Klink, the commandant of the camp, and John Banner was the inept sergeant-of-the-guard, Hans Schultz.

The series was popular during its six-season run. In 2013, creators Bernard Fein through his estate and Albert S. Ruddy acquired the sequel and other separate rights to Hogan's Heroes from Mark Cuban through arbitration and a movie based on the show has been planned.

episodes.name: The Informer
episodes.overview: At Stalag 13, a German prisoner-of-war camp, Colonel Robert Hogan and his fellow cohorts are a subversive group with many hidden talents. However, a spy has been planted amongst the men by the Germans. And when he learns of the gang's subversive operations, "Hogan's Heroes" must act fast to discredit him.

episodes.name: Hold the Tiger
episodes.overview: When Colonel Klink boasts that the Nazis' new Tiger Tank will lead the Germans to victory, Colonel Hogan devises a plan to get his hands on one of the vehicles, have it disassembled, send its blueprints to the Allies, and reassemble it --- right under Klink's nose.

episodes.name: Kommandant of the Year
episodes.overview: A Secret rocket bomb developed by the Germans is being hidden at Stalag 13. When an Allied scientist is sent to photograph and sabotage the weapon, Hogan and his men plan a distraction — in the form of a bogus "Kommandant of the Year" ceremony for the clueless Colonel Klink.

episodes.name: The Late Inspector General
episodes.overview: To prevent Colonel Klink from being transferred to the Russian front, Hogan and his men attempt to convince a visiting Inspector General that the Colonel is a cold, heartless disciplinarian. But their plan backfires when, as a result, Klink is promoted to a post in Berlin!

episodes.name: The Flight of the Valkyrie
episodes.overview: Hogan's scheme to help a German baroness escape to London is thwarted by the arrival of a new prisoner of war--- Colonel Crittendon--- whose repeated bungled attempts at escape are wreaking havoc on Hogan's mission to spirit away the baroness.

episodes.name: The Prisoner's Prisoner
episodes.overview: While on a sabotage caper, Hogan and Carter encounter a German general, overpower him, and smuggle him back to Stalag 13. Once there, they come up with a ploy to trick the disoriented general into revealing his troop's attack plans.

episodes.name: German Bridge is Falling Down
episodes.overview: Several attempts by Hogan and his men to destroy a German bridge end in failure --- until they decide to use the Nazis' own ammo to accomplish the task!

episodes.name: Movies Are Your Best Escape
episodes.overview: What's inside a visiting German general's briefcase --- the one that's chained to his wrist? The mystery becomes too tempting for Hogan. who not only wants to photograph the case's contents, but then sneak the photos out of Stalag 13 as well!

episodes.name: Go Light on the Heavy Water
episodes.overview: When a heavily guarded "water" truck appears one day and is parked inside the camp, Hogan and his men decide to find out just what kind of cargo the vehicle actually contains.

episodes.name: Top Hat, White Tie and Bomb Sight
episodes.overview: Hogan's only chance to pass some important information of to an underground contact is via a rendezvous in a nearby village --- So he convinces Colonel Klink that he will reveal valuable military secrets if he's allowed to have "a night on the town."

episodes.name: Happiness is a Warm Sergeant
episodes.overview: Sergeant Schultz, while escorting Newkirk to the dentist, gets drunk and is replaced by a hard-lined, no-nonsense guard. Hogan and his crew must act fast to get the docile Schultz restored to his post.

episodes.name: The Scientist
episodes.overview: LeBeau aids in the escape of a captured French scientist and his daughter, who are able to make it out of Germany. But now the men of Stalag 13 must find a suitable "replacement" scientist who can present and discuss the study's findings.

episodes.name: Hogan's Hofbrau
episodes.overview: When two ruthless German officers put the squeeze on Colonel Klink to contribute money to their phony cause "or else," Hogan and the gang must scramble to come up with the cash and deliver it in time to keep Klink out of harm's way as the camp's inept commandant.

episodes.name: Oil for the Lamps of Hogan
episodes.overview: The Germans' plan to build a synthetic fuel plant at Stalag 13 would spell disaster for Hogan's men and their important strategic subterfuge. So Hogan attempts to convince Klink that there's a massice oil supply under the camp --- and orders a phony Allied air raid on the camp as proof!

episodes.name: Reservations are Required
episodes.overview: An agreement to aid two escapees quickly goes awry when 20 men show up at the appointed hour. Where will Hogan and his gang find uniforms and papers for the men? And how will they get them out of Stalag 13, with German guards stationed near the end of the secret escape tunnel?

episodes.name: Anchors Aweigh, Men of Stalag 13
episodes.overview: When a British submarine cannot make a planned rendezvous to pick up a POW carrying an example of an important new German weapon, Hogan must come up with a sturdy, seaworthy replacement. Can he convince Colonel Klink to construct the camp's new officer's club in the form of a yacht?

episodes.name: Happy Birthday, Adolf
episodes.overview: The British plan to bomb a strategic German beach on Hitler's birthday, unaware that a major gun emplacement is at the site and the Allied planes will be sitting ducks. Hogan and his crew must figure out how to silence the guns in order for the air raid to be a success.

episodes.name: The Gold Rush
episodes.overview: A new prisoner reveals that a local bank nearby houses a shipment of gold stolen from the Bank of France by the Germans. When Hogan hears of the glittering cash, he decides it would be only proper to steal it back --- and return it to France after the war!

episodes.name: Hello, Zolle
episodes.overview: When Hogan informs London of an important German general"s imminent arrival at Stalag 13, he is told that he must detain the general at the camp for 24 hours  --- by whatever means necessary --- so that Allied forces can stage a raid on the visiting general's forces.

episodes.name: It Takes a Thief... Sometimes
episodes.overview: Hogan is enthusiastic about joining forces with an underground unit that is targeting a local railway tunnel --- unaware that the "saboteurs" are actually Gestapo agents masquerading as allies!

episodes.name: The Great Impersonation
episodes.overview: When LeBeau, Newkirk and Carter are captured by the Gestapo during a sabotage mission, Hogan must convince the affable sergeant Schultz to impersonate the stern Colonel Klink and demand their release.

episodes.name: The Pizza Parlor
episodes.overview: When an Italian POW camp commander arrives at Stalag 13 to train under Colonel Klink, Hogan and his gang try to convince the new arrival to go to work for the Allies by plying him with pizza.

episodes.name: The 43rd, a Moving Story
episodes.overview: Hogan's plan to destroy a mobile Nazi anti-aircraft battery is hampered by Colonel Klink's power-hungry peer, Major Kuehn.

episodes.name: How to Cook a German Goose by Radar
episodes.overview: The men of Stalag 13 are turned off by an American corporal's aloof attitude and boorish behavior --- until they discover he has come to the camp to ask for help in carrying out a sabotage mission.

episodes.name: Psychic Kommandant
episodes.overview: A startling, deadly new German weapon --- a secret, noiseless aircraft --- has been brought to Stalag 13 for testing, and Hogan's gang must do there best to tarnish its image so the Germans will cease production of the experimental plane.

episodes.name: The Prince from the Phone Company
episodes.overview: Kinchloe dresses up as an African prince, whom Hogan has kidnapped, in order to ask the Germans for money to open a submarine base. Complications arise when the prince's wife arrives.

episodes.name: The Safecracker Suite
episodes.overview: Colonel Klink's happy reunion with an old military buddy ends abruptly when the man is arrested by the Gestapo. Will Klink end up in the clink as well?

episodes.name: I Look Better in Basic Black
episodes.overview: The men of Stalag 13 have no interest in tunneling into a neighboring barracks that houses new prisoners --- until they discover that the new detainees are women!

episodes.name: The Assassin
episodes.overview: An important German nuclear scientist must be eliminated and Hogan's crew is asked to perform the task --- a plan that takes an unexpected twist when the scientist comes to Hogan and asks for help in fleeing the Nazi regime.

episodes.name: Cupid Comes to Stalag 13
episodes.overview: Colonel Klink is desperate after General Burkhalter plays matchmaker and pairs Klink with the general's monstrous sister, Gertude. Can Hogan deflect some of the Cupid's flying arrows away for the hapless, helpless Klink?

episodes.name: The Flame Grows Higher
episodes.overview: Somewhere along the elaborate, intricate underground escape route there is a disastrous weak link, Determined to find it, Hogan, Newkirk and Lebeau decide to break out of Stalag 13 by following the escape route themselves.

episodes.name: Request Permission to Escape
episodes.overview: Jilted by his girlfriend back home, Carter requests permission to escape so that he can somehow woo her back. Hogan agrees—but only if Carter can accomplish one last task of passing bogus battle plans on to the Germans.

episodes.name: Hogan Gives a Birthday Party
episodes.overview: A German oil refinery is so heavily protected that allied bombers have been unable to destroy it. So Colonel Hogan decides that the only way to fool the gunners is to use a German plane—and he makes plans to hijack one!

episodes.name: The Schultz Brigade
episodes.overview: When the hapless Colonel Klink reluctantly joins two other German prison camp commandants in a plot to discredit General Burkhalter, all three men are subsequently arrested. Hogan  and the gang must act quickly to keep their clueless commandant in charge of Stalag 13.

episodes.name: Diamonds in the Rough
episodes.overview: After being double-crossed by a female lure, Hogan and his men are confronted by a Gestapo agent who knows all about their secret operation and demands "hush" money --- in the form of a million dollars in diamonds!

episodes.name: Operation Briefcase
episodes.overview: Hogan is unexpectedly drawn into an assassination plot against Adolf Hitler when he is ordered to deliver a briefcase rigged with explosives to a German general involved in the plot.

episodes.name: The Battle of Stalag 13
episodes.overview: Two German officers have new and differing plans for Stalag 13 --- both of which threaten Hogan's operations. In order to protect the camp and the gang's secret subterfuge, Hogan plays the two men against each other.

episodes.name: The Rise and Fall of Sergeant Schultz
episodes.overview: Hogan is stymied over how to rescue a captured member of the underground until a potential diversion --- in the form of an old World War I buddy of Sergeant Schultz --- arrives at Stalag 13.

episodes.name: Hogan Springs
episodes.overview: Hogan manages to free four underground leaders from the Germans and smuggles the quartet into Stalag 13. But a plan to spirit the men off to freedom in England suddenly looks hopeless when a leaky pipe fills the gang's emergency tunnel with water!

episodes.name: A Klink, a Bomb and a Short Fuse
episodes.overview: All goes well when Hogan's gang steals Klink's code book from his safe, photographs the contents, and returns it to its proper place. But there's a small hitch --- Carter forgot to load the camera with film!

episodes.name: Tanks for the Memory
episodes.overview: When Newkirk discovers a new radio controlled tank that could win the war for Germany, the allies want Hogan and the men to photograph the tank and then destroy it --- but complication ensue during their mission.

episodes.name: A Tiger Hunt In Paris (1)
episodes.overview: In the first of a two-part story, "Tiger," a female underground agent, is arrested while trying to document some secret German bases and is held in Paris for questioning. So Hogan and LeBeau become stowaways aboard Klink's staff car and head for Paris to free her.

episodes.name: A Tiger Hunt In Paris (2)
episodes.overview: Part 2 of 2. While trying to free the underground agent "Tiger" in Paris, Hogan must seek help from a Parisian fortune teller and also enlist the aid of a man who is a look-alike for Nazi Police Chief Heinrich Himmler.

episodes.name: Will the Real Adolf Please Stand Up?
episodes.overview: With camp security raised, Hogan and his men are desperate to smuggle some top-secret photos of German fortifications to the allies. The solution? Make liberal use of Carter's remarkable impersonation of Adolf Hitler.

episodes.name: Don't Forget to Write
episodes.overview: The aristocratic Colonel Klink fails a routine physical exam and lands a combat assignment at the Russian front! Fearing a hard-line replacement at Stalag 13, the  men must do all they can to rescind Klink's marching papers.

episodes.name: Klink's Rocket
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men make plans to lure Luftwaffe bombers within range of an allied anti-aircraft installation hidden in an abandoned warehouse, but Carter make a shamble of the plan when, while "leaking" the info to Klink, he forgets the name of the town where the strategic warehouse is located.

episodes.name: Information Please
episodes.overview: Suspectin a security leak at Stalag 13, General Burkhalter goes fishing with some false information and Colonel Hogan falls for the bait. As a result, Burkhalter plants a spy among the prisoners to expose the guilty parties.

episodes.name: Art for Hogan's Sake
episodes.overview: An assertive General Burkhalter "requisitions" the famous Édouard Manet painting, "The Fife Player," from the Louvre museum in Paris to give to Hermann Goering as a birthday present. Undaunted by the seeming impossible logistics, Hogan and LeBeau decide to steal it back!

episodes.name: The General Swap
episodes.overview: Colonel Hogan is less the thrilled when he is assigned to help an obnoxious American general flee Stalag 13 --- and the secret escape plan, involving a prisoner swap, winds up as trying and difficult as the arrogant escapee himself.

episodes.name: The Great Brinksmeyer Robbery
episodes.overview: When the gang's hidden cache of money --- needed to purchase a secret map --- goes up in smoke, the men of Stalag 13 must come up with a way to replace the cash --- and decide to pull off a bank heist in the nearby town.

episodes.name: Praise the Führer and Pass the Ammunition
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men are determined to create chaos during some staged war games a ruthless Nazi colonel has scheduled near Stalag 13. So what do you suppose would happen if the fake explosives planned for the exercises were somehow replaced with live ammunition?

episodes.name: Hogan and the Lady Doctor
episodes.overview: Hogan nixes a mission to destroy a synthetic fuel plant because the caper is too risky....but he is overruled -- and forced to participate in the scheme by the ploy's mastermind, a strong-willed, determined female scientist.

episodes.name: The Swing Shift
episodes.overview: Masquerading as German workers, Hogan and the crew have made elaborate and foolproof plans to blow a German cannon factory sky-high --- but their plan backfires when Newkirk winds up being drafted into the German army!

episodes.name: Heil Klink
episodes.overview: When an important Gestapo official wants to defect, Hogan brings him to Stalag 13 --- and convinces Colonel Klink that the fugitive is Adolf Hitler in disguise... who is trying to elude assassins by hiding at the camp!

episodes.name: Everyone Has a Brother-in-Law
episodes.overview: Captain Kurtz, General Burkhalter's brother-in-law, becomes the camp's tough new adjutant. What's worse he's keeping a watchful eye on every corner of Stalag 13 and ends up getting in the way of Hogan's plans to blow up an enemy munitions train.

episodes.name: Killer Klink
episodes.overview: The bumbling Sergent Schultz has unwittingly been conned into making a trip to Heidelberg as courier for the underground, but after upsetting Colonel Klink, the sergeant is ordered to remain grounded at the camp. How will Hogan and the gang win him a new weekend pass?

episodes.name: Reverend Kommandant Klink
episodes.overview: When a French flier is captured, the Nazis verbally malign the man's fiancee in an attempt to get him to reveal important information. To keep him from cracking under the interrogation, Hogan smuggle the man's girlfriend into the stalag and arranges for the two to be married.

episodes.name: The Most Escape-Proof Camp I've Ever Escaped From
episodes.overview: Colonel Klink's "no escape" record is jeopardized when Malcolm Flood, a British escape artist, lands in Stalag 13 and intends to continue his impressive escape record --- a plan likely to endanger Colonel Hogan's scheduled rendezvous with an OSS agent.

episodes.name: The Tower
episodes.overview: When the Nazis construct a new communication tower near Stalag 13 -- one that is potentially deadly to the allies -- Hogan enlists a beautiful underground agent to help destroy the tower, with Kinchloe assigned to snap some incriminating photos of General Burkhalter.

episodes.name: Colonel Klink's Secret Weapon
episodes.overview: After receiving a "poor' rating from the Inspector General of prison camps, Colonel Klink brings in a stern new sergeant to discipline the prisoners. How can Hogan and his men make sure the camp's ruthless "discipline machine" has the shortest reign possible?

episodes.name: The Top Secret Top Coat
episodes.overview: A secret military document is mistakenly hidden in Colonel Klink's topcoat at a party, and a desperate Hogan must nab the document because of both its value to the allies and because Klink will be charged with treason and replaced at Stalag 13 if it is discovered in his possession.

episodes.name: The Reluctant Target
episodes.overview: Klink becomes convinced that he is marked for assassination by a mysterious "Mr. X" after a series of close calls at the stalag. Could Hogan be behind the threats? Yes... but it's all part of a plan to masquerade as Klink in order to help a valuable underground agent escape from the camp!

episodes.name: The Crittendon Plan
episodes.overview: Colonel Hogan is called on to destroy a German convoy inside a tunnel --- but he balks when he discovers that his accomplice will be his old adversary, Colonel Crittendon.

episodes.name: Some of Their Planes Are Missing
episodes.overview: The Germans' plan to shoot down British bombers by using captured RAF airplanes is uncovered, and Hogan and his men must attempt to destroy the aircraft before they can be flown on their deadly, deceptive mission.

episodes.name: D-Day at Stalag 13
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men play a part in the D-Day invasion of France when they are asked to create a diversion that will delay Colonel Klink and other German officials at Stalag 13 from retaliating once the invasion is underway.

episodes.name: Sergeant Schultz Meets Mata Hari
episodes.overview: Sergent Schultz falls head over heels for an attractive woman --- but Hogan suspects that she is a Gestapo agent and has Carter shadow the two loverbirds on one of their dates.

episodes.name: Funny Thing Happened on the Way to London
episodes.overview: Newkirk, Kinchloe and LeBeau must help Hogan fool the Germans with a look-alike German official to thwart the Nazis' planned assassination plot against British Prime Minister Winston Churchill.

episodes.name: Casanova Klink
episodes.overview: Klink's new secretary Gertude Linkmeyer decides to throw herself into the task of completely organizing the commandant's workplace --- an all-night project that throws a monkey wrench into Hogan's mission of raiding the safe in Klink's office.

episodes.name: How to Win Friends and Influence  Nazis
episodes.overview: A famed scientist is recruited by the Germans to develop a revolutionary new metal alloy for the Nazi war machine --- so Hogan and the gang must distract the doctor --- or worse --- to keep him from accomplishing his task.

episodes.name: Nights in Shining Armor
episodes.overview: Hogan must somehow deliver a shipment of bulletproof vests to the French underground --- and a captured French Resistance fighter seems to be the perfect candidate to help Hogan pull of the caper.

episodes.name: Hot Money
episodes.overview: Stalag 13 becomes the site for a German counterfeiting factory that will produce both American and British currencies. But Sergeant Schultz's sticky fingers inadvertently tip Hogan off to the scheme when Schultzy spends some of the "funny money" gambling at the prisoners' casino.

episodes.name: One in Every Crowd
episodes.overview: When Hogan and his men set out to destroy the Germans' new S-5 gun that's being guarded at Stalag 13, they uncover more then they bargained for --- a traitor amongst their ranks who has gone to Colonel Klink to report on Hogan's planned sabotage.

episodes.name: Is General Hammerschlag Burning?
episodes.overview: Paris is targeted for destruction should the Allied armies invade, so Hogan and Kinchloe secretly travel to the French capital to learn more about the plot --- and end up seeking help in their caper form an exotic dancer/ medium named Kumasa.

episodes.name: A Russian is Coming
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men face the difficult task of returning a Soviet pilot to his homeland --- especially when the fanatical, demanding Russian refuses to follow the usual escape route to England.

episodes.name: An Evening of Generals
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men have cleverly rigged the tabletop centerpieces to explode during a banquet for Germany's top generals --- unaware the one of the guests at the banquets is an invaluable spy working undercover for the Allies.

episodes.name: Everybody Loves a Snowman
episodes.overview: An American military captain and his crew hiding out at Stalag 13 face capture when Major Hochstetter and his search party zero in on the POW camp --- and its elaborate tunnel system to freedom is threatened with exposure.

episodes.name: The Hostage
episodes.overview: A rocket fuel depot that the Germans build near Stalag 13 is a tempting target for Hogan and his men. But is the new facility just part of a plan to lure Hogan into a trap?

episodes.name: Carter Turns Traitor
episodes.overview: To get the inside secrets of a Nazi chemical warfare facility, Hogan and his cohorts must convince the Germans that Carter has turned traitor and wishes to defect to the Third Reich.

episodes.name: Two Nazis for the Price of One
episodes.overview: Hogan's surreptitious operation --- as well as secret information on America's atom bomb project --- is threatened when it's discovers that a top Gestapo official knows all about Hogan's espionage activities and plans to offer him a deal.

episodes.name: Is There a Doctor in the House?
episodes.overview: Colonel Klink's sudden bout with the flu jeopardizes Hogan's plan to smuggle an underground agent out of the camp in the trunk of the ailing commandant's automobile.

episodes.name: Hogan, Go Home
episodes.overview: Colonel Hogan receives a stunning message: he's to return home to the U.S.A. for a hero's welcome. The men of Stalag 13, convinced the Hogan will remain at the camp to continue his operation, are further stunned when he is overjoyed at the news --- and plans to bid Stalag 13 a fond farewell!

episodes.name: Sticky Wicket Newkirk
episodes.overview: Corporal Newkirk sneaks into town for a romantic rendezvous with a German girl --- one who professes that she is on the side of the Allies. But when Newkirk sneaks her into the camp and shows her the gang's secret setup, she promptly reports her findings to Major Hochstetter!

episodes.name: War Takes a Holiday
episodes.overview: After a first attempt to sneak four underground leaders out of the German camp fails, Hogan and his men come up with a new plan: Convince the camp commanders, via radio broadcasts and newspaper headlines, that the war is over!

episodes.name: Duel of Honor
episodes.overview: Hogan and the gang decide that the hapless Colonel Klink would be the ideal patsy to use to get an important list of agents safely to England --- with a little boost from Carter's masquerade as a ferocious German general with a fondness for duels.

episodes.name: Axis Annie
episodes.overview: Hogan must deliver important information to a contact in the nearby town, but the Gestapo has cracked down tight on the camp. Will Hogan be forced to make traitorous pro-Nazi statements to Axis Annie of the German Propaganda Ministry in order to get the information to its destination?

episodes.name: What Time Does the Balloon Go Up?
episodes.overview: Has Colonel Hogan finally snapped under the pressure of confinement? The men think so when Hogan suggests that, to rescue a captured British agent, the men of Stalag 13 take up basket weaving, tent making and kite flying!

episodes.name: LeBeau and the Little Old Lady
episodes.overview: LeBeau's weekly visits to an underground contact --- one he describes as a "mean little old lady" --- are revealed as something more after Hogan and the men discover that the "lady" is actually a beautiful young Dutch woman with whom LeBeau has fallen in love.

episodes.name: How to Escape From Prison Camp Without Really Trying
episodes.overview: Hogan is asked to immobilize the entire German 6th SS division --- 10,000 men --- for two days while the Allies organize a surprise attack. The task seems impossible, especially in the presence of the two stern Gestapo colonels who are filling in for a vacationing Colonel Klink.

episodes.name: The Collector General
episodes.overview: An arrogant German general arrives at Stalag 13 and orders Colonel Klink to guard a truckload of ammunition. But when Hogan discovers that the "ammo" is actually a collection of valuable pieces of art stolen from France, he masterminds a little theft of his own.

episodes.name: The Ultimate Weapon
episodes.overview: The Germans' top-secret weapon in there war effect is --- Sergent Schultz??? General Burkhalter and the other camp officials begin to think so after Schutzy starts to predict Allied attacks with uncanny accuracy!

episodes.name: Monkey Business
episodes.overview: Carter returns from an unsuccessful mission with a new pal in tow --- a runaway chimpanzee from the local bombed-out zoo. The men of Stalag 13 decide to make "Freddy" their barracks mascot --- but Hogan sees a more practical use for the happy-go-lucky chimp.

episodes.name: Drums Along the Dusseldorf
episodes.overview: A German truck carrying an experimental jet fuel is the latest target for Hogan and the gang. But when all efforts to sabotage the shipment fail, Carter decides to get down to business with the remaining weaponry at hand --- a bow and arrow!

episodes.name: Clearance Sale at the Black Market
episodes.overview: It appears Sergeant Schultz will be shipped off to the Russian front after he accidentally interrupts a black market meeting. If he goes, Colonel Hogan will lose his courier of secret messages between Stalag 13 and a female spy.

episodes.name: Klink vs. the Gonculator
episodes.overview: When Sergeant Carter constructs an amazingly complicated rabbit trap, a suspicious Colonel Klink comes to believe that the contraption is a secret electronic spying device.

episodes.name: How to Catch a Papa Bear
episodes.overview: Colonel Hogan innocently sends Corporal Newkirk off on a mission to rendezvous with an ally --- unaware that the meeting is a trap set up by the Gestapo.

episodes.name: Hogan's Trucking Service ... We Deliver the Factory to You
episodes.overview: The clumsy and annoying Colonel Crittendon inadvertently messes up Hogan's plans to destroy a German ball-bearing plant.

episodes.name: To the Gestapo with Love
episodes.overview: Is love blind? Three beautiful German girls arrive at Stalag 13 and set the men's hearts beating faster --- but their mission is designed to pry secrets out of the love-struck POWs.

episodes.name: Man's Best Friend is Not His Dog
episodes.overview: A canine caper is off and running when a dog buries a bone containing photographic images of a new German tank that Carter had taken with his camera.

episodes.name: Never Play Cards with Strangers
episodes.overview: Hogan dispatches Sergeant Kinchloe on a mission to warn Newkirk and Carter that the duo's mission to dynamite a newly-established Nazi rocket fuel installation could blow up in their faces.

episodes.name: Color the Luftwaffe Red
episodes.overview: How will Hogan steal an important, strategic map from the Germans? By underbidding all competitors for the contract to paint the offices of Luftwaffe headquarters.

episodes.name: Guess Who Came to Dinner?
episodes.overview: After making arrangements to send her to England, Hogan begins to worry that his beautiful underground contact, Heidi, might actually be a double agent.

episodes.name: No Names Please
episodes.overview: Shortly after Hogan helps a journalist escape to freedom, the Germans are amazed to read an American newspaper story about a sabotage-and-subterfuge unit hard at work right under their noses at one of their POW camps.

episodes.name: Bad Day in Berlin
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men join forces with an undercover agent and steal away to Berlin to nab a German defector who can compromise their entire operation at Stalag 13.

episodes.name: Will the Blue Baron Strike Again?
episodes.overview: Can Hogan locate the secret German air base commanded by a World War I flying ace known as the Blue Baron? Yes --- by convincing Colonel Klink to throw a party for the famed aviator.

episodes.name: Will the Real Colonel Klink Please Stand Up Against the Wall?
episodes.overview: The hapless Colonel Klink lands a date with a German firing squad after Sergeant Carter, disguised as Klink, is spotted at a sabotage site.

episodes.name: Man in a Box
episodes.overview: Hogan is ordered to capture an "escaped" Corporal Louis LeBeau --- but in a manner that will ensure LeBeau's completion of an espionage caper.

episodes.name: The Missing Klink
episodes.overview: Hogan's scheme to kidnap General Burkhalter and trade him for an underground agent goes awry when Colonel Klink --- not the general --- is the one who gets kidnapped.

episodes.name: Who Stole My Copy of Mein Kampf?
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men plan to eliminate an allied defector, but complications ensue when their target turns out to be a beautiful woman.

episodes.name: Operation Hannibal
episodes.overview: A German general is the mastermind behind a plan designed to prolong the war, so Hogan winds up working with the general's daughter in an effort to photograph the strategic documents.

episodes.name: My Favorite Prisoner
episodes.overview: When Colonel Klink uses a beautiful baroness to try to wheedle secrets out of Colonel Hogan, he apparently falls under the femme fatale's charms. Or does he?

episodes.name: Watch the Trains Go By
episodes.overview: Hogan's plan to sneak out of Stalag 13 and blow up a German train hinges on getting General Burkhalter's lovelorn sister --- the marriage-minded Gertrude --- to distract Colonel Klink.

episodes.name: Klink's Old Flame
episodes.overview: The French underground is in desperate need of valuable radios, so Hogan decides to utilize Colonel Klink's former girlfriend to ensure the delivery of the equipment.

episodes.name: Up in Klink's Room
episodes.overview: Hogan must somehow get himself hospitalized so that he can get top-secret information from a wounded British agent who has been posing as a Nazi officer.

episodes.name: The Purchasing Plan
episodes.overview: The race is on when Hogan and his men are ordered to collect air-dropped ammunition and distribute it to underground units widely scattered around the region.

episodes.name: The Witness
episodes.overview: Hogan is stunned to learn that the Germans are planning to send him to England, with a startling message for the Allied forces: surrender, or face the Nazis' "ultimate weapon."

episodes.name: The Big Dish
episodes.overview: Hogan's latest mission: destroy an elaborate anti-aircraft defense system designed by a beautiful English woman who has defected to Germany.

episodes.name: The Return of Major Bonacelli
episodes.overview: An Italian officer, who once studied under Colonel Klink, is the ideal candidate to assist Hogan and his men in a daring plan to photograph a new Nazi gun installation.

episodes.name: Happy Birthday, Dear Hogan
episodes.overview: To celebrate Colonel Hogan's birthday with a bang, his men plan to surprise him by blowing up a Nazi ammunition dump. But will the merry celebrants fall into an elaborate trap set by the Germans?

episodes.name: Hogan Goes Hollywood
episodes.overview: To transmit information home, Colonel Hogan plans to cast an American actor to star in a German propaganda film.

episodes.name: The Well
episodes.overview: Hogan steals the Luftwaffe codebook, but can't use it after Newkirk accidentally drops it down a well.

episodes.name: The Klink Commandos
episodes.overview: In order to steal key documents, Hogan and his men volunteer for a German suicide-squad train bound for the Russian front.

episodes.name: The Gasoline War
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men plan to demolish a gasoline station that's just been built in camp.

episodes.name: Unfair Exchange
episodes.overview: Hogan kidnaps General Burkhalter's sister, with the intention of exchanging her for a captured Allied agent.

episodes.name: The Kommandant Dies at Dawn
episodes.overview: Colonel Klink is set up for execution after the gestapo finds him with underground information --- planted on him by Hogan.

episodes.name: Bombsight
episodes.overview: A new weapon is about to be tested and Hogan schemes to get the blueprints to foil its detonation.

episodes.name: The Big Picture
episodes.overview: When the Gestapo blackmails Klink, Hogan plans to steal the incriminating photo.

episodes.name: The Big Gamble
episodes.overview: Hogan plots to keep a secret device, hidden on board a downed plane, from the Germans.

episodes.name: The Defector
episodes.overview: A defecting Field Marshal tailed by Major Hochstetter to Stalag 13 needs Hogan's help to get to England.

episodes.name: The Empty Parachute
episodes.overview: By planting an opened parachute in camp, Hogan tricks the Germans into looking for an Allied agent --- so he can find the missing briefcase that was handcuffed to a courier.

episodes.name: The Antique
episodes.overview: Hogan convinces Klink to open a business selling "rare" cuckoo clocks, which Hogan plans to use for smuggling information.

episodes.name: Is There a Traitor in the House?
episodes.overview: Hogan plans to filter information into London through the wires of a German propaganda radio broadcast.

episodes.name: At Last-Schultz Knows Something
episodes.overview: Hogan prods Sergeant Schultz to reveal the site of a secret atomic installation that Schultz has been assigned to guard.

episodes.name: How's the Weather?
episodes.overview: Hogan throws an anniversary party for Klink, planning to use party balloons to forecast the weather.

episodes.name: Get Fit or Go Fight
episodes.overview: Hogan convinces Klink to get back in shape so he won't be shipped to the Russian front.

episodes.name: Fat Hermann, Go Home
episodes.overview: Things heat up as Hogan schemes to return a load of stolen paintings to London, just as Marya convinces Schultz to impersonate Reich Marshal Goering.

episodes.name: The Softer They Fall
episodes.overview: "Kinch" agrees to fight a German boxing champ to divert attention from a heist that Hogan is planning.

episodes.name: Gowns by Yvette
episodes.overview: By having LeBeau design her gown, Hogan plans to use the wedding of Burkhalter's niece as a smokescreen to smuggle a defector out of Germany.

episodes.name: One Army at a Time
episodes.overview: When he's captured in German uniform, Carter convinces the Germans that he is one of them.

episodes.name: Standing Room Only
episodes.overview: Hogan tries to save Klink from the officer who wants to turn him in for his lousy bookkeeping skills.

episodes.name: Six Lessons From Madame LaGrange
episodes.overview: With the help of a singer, Hogan schemes to prevent the Gestapo from arresting all the local Allied agents.

episodes.name: The Sergeant's Analyst
episodes.overview: Schultz is headed for the Russian front because Burkhalter caught him goofing off.

episodes.name: The Merry Widow
episodes.overview: To transport secret documents, Hogan sets up Klink with a female agent --- but when the wrong documents fall into Klink's hands, Schultz becomes the delivery boy.

episodes.name: Crittendon's Commandos
episodes.overview: On a mission to capture Rommel, Colonel Crittendon and his commandos parachute into camp, but the Colonel is the only one to avoid capture.

episodes.name: Klink's Escape
episodes.overview: Hogan gets Klink to believe he is about to bust a POW escape ring.

episodes.name: Cuisine à la Stalag 13
episodes.overview: Colonel Hogan needs LeBeau to whip up something special for a German general, but the chef has made plans to escape to France.

episodes.name: The Experts
episodes.overview: When the Gestapo targets Colonel Klink's radio expert, Hogan helps save him before he's silenced for good.

episodes.name: Klink's Masterpiece
episodes.overview: Hogan convinces Klink that he is a great artist so he can smuggle out some maps in the Kommandant's canvases.

episodes.name: Lady Chitterly's Lover (1)
episodes.overview: Part 1 of 2. When Sir Charles Chitterly parachutes into Stalag 13, Hogan asks Colonel Crittendon to pretend he's Sir Charles --- but Lady Chitterly isn't fooled.

episodes.name: Lady Chitterly's Lover (2)
episodes.overview: Part 2 of 2. Hogan fears the phony Sir Charles can't trick Hitler. Things get even more complicated when Chitterly escapes from the prisoner's tunnel.

episodes.name: The Gestapo Takeover
episodes.overview: The heroes try to prevent the Gestapo from sending Klink and Schultz to the Russian front.

episodes.name: Kommandant Schultz
episodes.overview: When Schultz is put in command, his mania for power jeopardizes Hogan's plan to smuggle uranium to London.

episodes.name: Eight O'clock and All is Well
episodes.overview: Right after he tells a new prisoner about their secret operations, Hogan discovers he's a German spy.

episodes.name: The Big Record
episodes.overview: When Klink gives the heroes a tape recorder so they can send messages back home, Hogan has bigger plans for the device.

episodes.name: It's Dynamite
episodes.overview: Hogan's plot to hijack a dynamite truck takes a different tack when the truck makes an unscheduled stop.

episodes.name: Operation Tiger
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men mastermind the ambush of a Gestapo train that's transporting an underground agent to Berlin.

episodes.name: The Big Broadcast
episodes.overview: The heroes use Klink's car radio to pass information to an underground agent about a German rocket factory.

episodes.name: The Gypsy
episodes.overview: To smuggle out an anti-radar device, Hogan passes LeBeau off as a fortune-teller after convincing Klink he's been struck by lightning.

episodes.name: The Dropouts
episodes.overview: When three Gestapo officers detain Hogan and Carter, the two frantically plan their escape --- until they learn the officers want to defect.

episodes.name: Easy Come, Easy Go
episodes.overview: Klink takes Hogan to England to steal an Allied plane, but Hogan has other plans --- to expose some Nazi spies.

episodes.name: The Meister Spy
episodes.overview: The heroes pose a Nazi officers to root out a German spy posing as an American pilot.

episodes.name: That's No Lady, That's My Spy
episodes.overview: Dressed as a general's wife, Newkirk attends a tea party to deliver penicillin to an underground leader.

episodes.name: To Russia Without Love
episodes.overview: To get ahold of secret papers, Hogan enlists a beautiful Russian spy to convince Klink he's needed at the Russian front.

episodes.name: Klink for the Defense
episodes.overview: When Klink gets assigned to defend a German officer accused of treason, Hogan helps to prove his innocence.

episodes.name: The Kamikazes Are Coming
episodes.overview: When a rocket lands near camp, the heroes don't know how they'll smuggle it out --- until Russian spy Marya comes on the scene.

episodes.name: Kommandant Gertrude
episodes.overview: General Burkhalter's sister Gertrude thinks her dim-witted fiance should be made Klink's assistant, which interferes with Hogan's plan to aid an American general.

episodes.name: Hogan's Double Life
episodes.overview: When Gestapo agents accuse Hogan of sabotage, he explains that his exact double, a German traitor, is the real culprit.

episodes.name: Look at the Pretty Snowflakes
episodes.overview: Hogan and his men start an avalanche to prevent Panzer tanks from reaching their destination.

episodes.name: Rockets or Romance
episodes.overview: Hogan and a beautiful underground agent team up to immobilize three mobile rocket launchers.
